provider.name: singleplatform
provider.attributionText: Disclaimer: Always check with the business for pricing and availability of menu items. SinglePlatform is not responsible for menu or pricing changes, but the information is believed to be accurate when posted. Listing of a menu does not mean that there is any affiliation, endorsement or sponsorship between SinglePlatform and the listed business.

items.description: Two steamed buns filled with your choice of either pork, chicken, or eggplant & eringi, served with ippudo's original spicy buns sauce and mayo

items.description: Yellowtail sashimi with graprfruit, finely diced peppers wasabi - avocado relish, and a wafu-yuzu dressing

items.name: Maguro Tartar
items.description: Freshly diced seared tuna infused with garlic soy and herb wasabi oil, garnished with avocado and tonburi seeds

items.name: Tori Tatsuta-Age
items.description: Ippudo's classic marinated chicken, delicately fried, served with grated daikon ponzu sauce

items.name: Bakuretsu Tofu
items.description: Stewed spicy tofu with minced pork, and crunchy noodles served in a sizzling stone pot

items.name: Umami Mekyabetsu

items.name: Tofu & Nasu Agedashi

items.name: Tako Spicy Grill
items.description: Grilled spanish octopus and potatoes seasoned with ippudo chili and cilantro

items.name: Yuzu Pepper Shrimp
items.description: Shrimp, bok choy, and eringi mushroom sauteed in a yuzu pepper sauce served over a bed of crunchy fried ramen noodles

items.name: Samurai Rib
items.description: Braised and grilled pork spare ribs, seasoned with soy based 'tare' sauce served with seven-spice chili pepper

items.name: Hakata Tonpu Yaki
items.description: A savory pancake with sliced pork belly and cabbage, topped with okonomiyaki sauce, japanese mayo, and hanakatsuo

items.name: Hotate Yaki
items.description: Pan fried scallops, carrot-saikyo miso, balsamic reduction. Fried kale and black pepper

items.name: Kamo Sukiyaki
items.description: Thin slices of duck breast simmered in a shallow clay pot with yaki tofu, shiitake & enoki mushrooms, tokyo leeks, a poached egg, and ramen noodles in traditional sukiyaki sauce

items.name: Gindara Saikyo Yaki
items.description: Grilled black cod marinated with saikyo miso

items.description: Filet mignon steak grilled with asparagus, served with garlic butter and japanese onion sauce

items.description: 300ml

items.name: Shiromaru Hakata Classic
items.description: The original silky "tonkotsu" (pork) soup noodles topped with pork loin chashu, sesame kikurage mushrooms, memma, red pickled ginger, & scallions. Topping suggestions: nitamago $2, shigureni$4

items.name: Akamaru Modern
items.description: The original silky "tonkotsu" (pork) soup noodles topped with ippudo's secret "umami dama" miso paste, pork chashu, cabage, sesame kikurage mushrooms, scallions, & fragrant garlic oil. Topping suggestions: nitamago $2, takana $3

items.name: Tori Ramen
items.description: Ippudo's "chintan" clear chicken and pork soup noodles topped with pork loin chashu, menma, minced shiso onion and arako chili pepper. Suggestions: poached egg $2, menma $4

items.name: Wasabi Shoyu Ramen
items.description: Soy sauce and vegetable based noodle soup, topped with bean curd, wasabi, menma, nori, tempura flakes scallions, and wasabi infused oil. Topping suggestions: nitamago $2

items.name: Kae-Dama
items.description: Kae-dama is a system that offers you an extra serving of noodles. When you have almost finished your first serving of noodles, order by saying, "kae-dama, please". In a few minutes the server will bring you another 'ball of noodles', & put it in the soup. At that time, you must have enough amount of the soup in the bowl to accommodate the new noodles, that is, you shouldn't drink too much of the soup if you are going to order the kae-dama

items.name: Kae-Dama
items.description: Kae dama is a system that offers you an extra serving of noodles. When you have almost finished your first serving of noodles, order by saying "Kae-dama, please." Your server will quickly bring you another 'ball of noodles' and put it in the soup. At that time, you must have enough soup in the bowl to accommodate the new noodles; that is, you shouldn't drink too much of the soup if you are going to order the Kae-dama
